comments.body: We should actually change in the main codes too .. and remove `keyword_only`. Of course in a separate PR.

> and remove `keyword_only`.

I was actually looking at this problem this week, but I am not sure if it makes sense to remove it completely.  Having keyword only arguments would be great, but we'll still have to do something to capture arguments.

Also, `keyword_only` has been used in the wild, though maybe not at the large scale.

Overall I was thinking about:

- Marking `__init__` and `setParams` with keyword only, primarily to make things explicit.
- Preserving `keyword_only` for the time being.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +60,64 @@    def __init__(
        self,
        *,
        rawPredictionCol: str = ...,
        labelCol: str = ...,
